reviewText: "Salvage 1" is one of the almost forgotten tv programs that possesses three great elements. It has a great "spaceship," a great theme song, and of course, Andy Griffith. In the seventies, the great Mayor of Mayberry tried several television programs after his previous successful eight year run. In the Salvage 1, perhaps he came the closest with a first rate cast, a decent premise, and a somewhat more flamboyant personality than he ever did on earlier successes.According to various sources, there are about four unaired episodes that were never telecast after ABC decided to trash the series after the two hour second season premiere. That's quite a shame, because I could never understand how a network could afford to waste money like that, even after a non-renewal order has been given out.  But because of this, those four episodes could raise the release of the Salvage 1 series a "Holy Grail" if some studio decides to put the money and resources to do a high quality digital restoration.Lastly, the Salvage 1 "spaceship" really deserves to have its own model or kit released. So many kids have replicas and toys from Star Trek or Star Wars, but not many have memorabilia from Salvage 1 or Quark.  I'd pay good money for that.JThreeWilliston ND
Title: N/A

reviewText: I loved this show.  Well written.  Great actors.  I don't understand why it has not been released already instead of the tons of junk I have to sift through to find something decent to buy.

reviewText: Hard to remember the show from 30 years ago! Andy Griffith makes his TV comeback as a junk dealer who builds a rocket to collect all the space junk and re-sell. Only 1 season (20 eps) only 16 ever aired on TV! Good adventure
